definition:
an attribute that applies to an equation
or to a set of equations
opposite_reasoning: PhysicalAttribute provides the strongest and most fundamental opposition to EquationAttribute. This pairing captures the core Abstract↔Physical distinction in SUMO ontology: EquationAttribute applies exclusively to abstract mathematical entities, while PhysicalAttribute applies to concrete physical objects. This opposition is conceptually clean, well-established in SUMO, and provides maximal semantic distance for Fisher-LDA steering. While not directly relevant to deception detection, it provides a robust axis for distinguishing abstract formal reasoning from physical world reasoning.
